message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a novel training strategy for the infinite restricted Boltzmann machine (iRBM) to improve its convergence speed and generalization ability. It also involves experiments on two popular datasets in the machine learning community, which further supports its relevance to this sub-category. 

It could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as the iRBM is a type of neural network and the paper proposes a new training method for it. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the iRBM is a type of AI model and the paper proposes a new method to improve its performance. 

Furthermore, it could be classified under cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as the experiments are conducted on image datasets and the iRBM can be used for image recognition tasks. 

Lastly, it could be categorized under cs.SD (Sound) as the iRBM can also be used for audio signal processing tasks and the proposed training strategy may also be applicable in this domain.
